item.title: Potholes, 28th October
item.description:
Email received via Customer Services : I live in a block of flats along a private road (Fox Hollow Drive). Along this road, there are several huge pot holes that are extremely dangerous to bike users and damaging to cars, that are only getting worse. Alongside this, there are no enforcements to reduce speed, there are no signs, no speed humps. Children often play in the private road and there are multiple cars that go speeding down the private road. I would welcome some enforcements to reduce the speed. I have raised these issues with my building management company but have been informed that the road belongs to Bexley council. Can this be looked into please?
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Fox Hollow Drive, Welling, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Missing Bus Stop markings after resurfacing., 28th October
item.description:
As with the stop on the opposite side of the road at the bottom of Edgebury, (Ref 8344996) the bus stop markings on this side of the road have also not been painted back on the road after the Edgebury resurfacing. This needs doing URGENTLY. If not, then once Edgebury school reopens next week, parents will park very close to the actual bus stop, as was the case until the bus stop road markings were introduced a few years ago. This caused significant issues previously for the 160 bus, particularly when it needed to pull in close to the kerb and lower the back door ramp, to pick up/drop off passengers with accessibility difficulties.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 84, Edgebury, Elmstead, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: MANHOLE COVER MISSING o/s no 16, 28th October
item.description:
Resident reporting there is a manhole cover missing on the road o/s No 16. Please could someone look into this urgently as a small animal or child can fall into this. There are a lot of dog walkers in this area passing as there is a local park nearby. It needs to be made secure and safe especially for the elderly residents who live along there & close by. It is dangerous to be left exposed
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Appledore Crescent, Longlands, London
Report on FixMyStreet
